intro: Euryspermum aemulum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved euryspermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. It is a perennial herb that produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps.
